title.value: Myelin basic protein mRNA levels affect myelin sheath dimensions, architecture, plasticity, and density of resident glial cells
title.justification: The title of the paper is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Myelin basic protein mRNA levels affect myelin sheath dimensions, architecture, plasticity, and density of resident glial cells

extractions.description: This research investigates the impact of different levels of Myelin Basic Protein (MBP) mRNA on the dimensions, architecture, plasticity of the myelin sheath, and the density of glial cells. By using enhancer-edited mouse models with varied MBP mRNA levels, the study explores the relationship between molecular regulation and Myelin sheath development across the lifespan of mice.

type.justification: The paper reports on experiments conducted using mouse models to investigate the effects of Myelin Basic Protein mRNA levels on myelin sheath and glial cell density, indicating an empirical nature.
type.quote: Here, to investigate these questions, we used enhancer-edited mouse lines that accumulate Mbp mRNA levels ranging from 8% to 160% of wild type.

name.justification: The study focuses on Myelin Basic Protein and its effects on myelin sheaths and glial cells, topics central to Neuroscience.
name.quote: This investigation extends understanding of the role MBP plays in myelin sheath elaboration, architecture, and plasticity across the mouse lifespan.

name.justification: The study involves molecular techniques to analyze mRNA levels and protein impacts.
name.quote: To evaluate potential effects of MBP reduction on the relationship between white and gray matter volumes in spinal cord, we evaluated their relative areas in cross-sections of C5-C6 spinal cord at P30.

name.justification: The research involves studying gene expression and genetic modifications in mice to understand the biological phenomenon.
name.quote: Mutations in genes encoding myelin components have illuminated the specific roles played by major myelin proteins (Miyata, 2019).

name.justification: The paper mentions using Axondeepseg for segmenting images of fibers which indicates the use of this model.
name.quote: fibers segmented using Axondeepseg (Zaimi et al., 2018).

is_contributed.justification: Axondeepseg is referenced in the context of segmentation, not as a new contribution by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: fibers segmented using Axondeepseg (Zaimi et al., 2018).

is_executed.justification: The model was executed for segmenting fibers.
is_executed.quote: fibers segmented using Axondeepseg (Zaimi et al., 2018).

is_compared.justification: There is no evidence suggesting that Axondeepseg's performance was compared to other models.
is_compared.quote: fibers segmented using Axondeepseg (Zaimi et al., 2018).

referenced_paper_title.value: AxonDeepSeg: Automatic axon and myelin segmentation from microscopy data using convolutional neural networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title is mentioned in the references as the source for Axondeepseg.
referenced_paper_title.quote: AxonDeepSeg: Automatic axon and myelin segmentation from microscopy data using convolutional neural networks
